basics.name: Nick Van Dyck
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I’m an enthusiastic and passionate senior software engineer with over 6 years of experience. I'm fond of all things web and always striving to build user friendly, scalable and stable web solutions that get users engaged. Trained in the dark arts of full stack development I have gained experience in a broad range of technologies and languages. Eventually I hope to pursue a role where I can have a high impact on the product. In my spare time I like to hack on open source or personal projects, read books or watch a good movie.

work.name: DataCamp
work.summary: I'm currently working at DataCamp on a team that tries to deliver a great learning experience.

work.name: MOO
work.description: MOO is a premium print and design company transforming the physical branding space with unique and beautiful products.
work.summary: At MOO I was part of a small team that got tasked to build a new application focussed on professional and hobbyist designers to enable them to create astonishing print products. In its essence this was an upload experience that guided customers through the process of putting their custom design on a card and get a high quality product shipped right to their door step. I worked in an agile team focussed both on frontend and backend. A test driven first methodology and good CI/CD practices allowed us to ship new features to our customers on a daily basis. I was also involved in a wider initiative to help create a shared design, style and component library. I kicked of the tires for a new react component library that helped teams deliver new UI features faster and reduce duplication across the company. With the HR department I helped to ensure our recruitment campaigns were inviting to a diverse range of applicants.
highlights: Developed shared components library in react that was conform the company design guidelines.
Frontend: React, Redux, Mobx, HTML5, Sass, Styled Components, JavaScript, Babel, Webpack
CI/Devops: Gitlab, Git, AWS, Linux, Kubernetes, Docker

work.name: Marks and Spencer
work.description: British retailer that specializes in clothing, homeware and luxury food products.
work.summary: I worked as part of a cross functional agile team building a brand new Christmas Food to Order platform, allowing customers to order their Christmas and New Year's dinner. This was a re-platforming project set out to replace the previous website, be more flexible and attractive to customers. It smashed its objectives and was a great success with an uplift in sales year on year. The application was developed following twelve-factor app methodologies running on multiple cloud providers and regions, allowing us to have high availability.
highlights: 12 factor web application deployed to several cloud foundry providers and regions
Frontend: Progressive enhancement, Sass, RxJS, Javascript, Babel, Webpack, AngularJS, ...
Backend: Python 3, Flask, Jinja2, Waitress, Node.js
CI/Devops: Github, Git, Cloud Foundry, Codeship

work.name: SDWorx
work.description: SDWorx is a Belgian based HR and payroll company. The company provides services related to employment, salary calculations, social legislation, taxation and human resources.
work.summary: As a software engineer I was involved in the development of their main web portal. High availability and strong performance were key for the project. I was heavily involved in making their website mobile friendly and I got involved in the development and maintenance of internal micro sites.

work.name: TecIT
work.description: For Tec IT I worked as a try and hire developer for a company called SDWorx.
work.summary: I was given the opportunity to get exposed to a broad range of trainings and learned the ins and outs of web development. I gained experience in C#, ASPNET, JavaScript, … The focus was heavily on internal micro sites, like a marketing campaign management and contract management tool.
highlights: Frontend: jQuery, Backbone, gulp, Node.js, npm, JavaScript

courses: Developed an intelligent FAQ system in ASP.NET for students of the Halmstad University. I was part of an international team working on all aspects of the application.
